question: [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/common/mod.rs] [Function: OutputArgs::write()] [Information Disclosure] Do error messages from std::fs::write() leak sensitive filesystem paths, validator directory structure, or permission information that could help attackers map the validator node's security posture? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/common/mod.rs] [Function: OutputArgs::write()] [Information Disclosure] If write() fails due to permission errors, does the error propagation reveal whether certain critical validator files exist at specific paths, aiding reconnaissance attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/common/mod.rs] [Function: OutputArgs::write()] [Error Handling] Does write() properly handle and propagate I/O errors, or could silent failures cause monitoring systems to miss critical validator health issues leading to consensus degradation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/common/mod.rs] [Function: OutputArgs::write()] [Error Handling] What happens if std::fs::write() returns an error after partial write - is there cleanup logic to remove incomplete files that could confuse monitoring dashboards? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/common/mod.rs] [Function: OutputArgs::write()] [Error Handling] Are filesystem-specific errors (like EIO, ENOSPC, EROFS) properly distinguished to help operators diagnose validator storage issues? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/common/mod.rs] [Function: OutputArgs::write()] [Information Disclosure] When output_path is None and output goes to stdout via println!(), can this leak sensitive validator metrics if the node-checker is run in containers where stdout is logged to centralized systems accessible by attackers? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/common/mod.rs] [Function: OutputArgs::write()] [Information Disclosure] Does the stdout path properly sanitize output to prevent terminal escape sequence injection that could manipulate operator terminals or hide malicious activity in validator logs? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/common/mod.rs] [Function: OutputArgs::write()] [Resource Exhaustion] Can extremely large output strings to stdout cause buffer overflows or excessive memory allocation in logging pipelines, affecting validator observability? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/common/mod.rs] [Function: OutputArgs::write()] [Availability] If stdout is redirected to a pipe that blocks or a closed fd, can println!() cause the node-checker to hang or panic, disrupting validator health monitoring? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/common/mod.rs] [Function: OutputArgs::write()] [Information Disclosure] Are there differences in error handling between the file-write and stdout paths that could leak information or cause inconsistent behavior? (Low)
